summary: This is an internal email chain from July 31, 2020, within the U.S. Department of Justice regarding a media inquiry from the Daily Mail. The inquiry asks for comment on claims in newly unsealed court documents that Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz pressured the DOJ to give Jeffrey Epstein a favorable plea deal in 2007.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) of an internal DOJ email forwarding a media inquiry about the Epstein case.

persons.name: Daniel Bates
persons.context: The journalist who submitted the media inquiry to the DOJ, asking for comment on claims about pressure on Epstein's 2007 plea deal.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Named in the media inquiry as allegedly putting pressure on the DOJ to give Jeffrey Epstein a favorable plea deal in 2007, according to unsealed court documents.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Named in the media inquiry as allegedly putting pressure on the DOJ to give Jeffrey Epstein a favorable plea deal in 2007, according to unsealed court documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the inquiry; the financier who received a plea deal in 2007, which the media inquiry claims was influenced by Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the defendant in the civil case from which the documents about pressure on Epstein's plea deal were unsealed.

connections.description: The media inquiry references a claim that Prince Andrew put pressure on the DOJ regarding Epstein's plea deal, implying a connection between them.
The media inquiry references a claim that Alan Dershowitz put pressure on the DOJ regarding Epstein's plea deal, implying Dershowitz acted in a legal capacity for Epstein.
Maxwell is described in the inquiry as Epstein's 'alleged madam,' indicating a close operational association.

events.title: Epstein's Plea Deal
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein received a favorable plea deal from the DOJ in 2007. Newly unsealed court documents allegedly claim this deal was influenced by pressure from Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz.

events.title: Daily Mail Media Inquiry
events.description: Journalist Daniel Bates from the Daily Mail submits an inquiry to the DOJ asking for comment on claims about pressure on Epstein's 2007 plea deal, based on newly unsealed civil case documents.

keyFacts: A July 2020 media inquiry from the Daily Mail references newly unsealed court documents from a civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The inquiry claims the unsealed documents allege that Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz put pressure on the DOJ to give Jeffrey Epstein a favorable plea deal in 2007.
The internal DOJ email chain shows staff, including a contractor, discussing how to handle the reporter's request, specifically whether to ask the reporter for a copy of the referenced document.
